4.8 The Privacy of Animals

Alan Westin (1967) surveyed several studies of animals, demonstrating
that a desire for privacy is not restricted to humans. One of the more
recent contemporary debates on privacy concerns the question of
whether animals should have (a right to) privacy. Pepper (2020)
defends such a right, since nonhuman animals also have an


interest in shaping different kinds of relationships with one another
by giving us control over how we present ourselves to others…
which grounds a right against us. (2020: 628; see also Paci et al.
2022)
